III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section Sufficiency of staff.
Description (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Two youth went AWOL from the facility. One youth spoke with an
unknown male outside of the facility who called the youth's father
on the youth's behalf. The youth's father asked the male to return
to youth to the facility. No harm was known to come to the youth.
When the stranger returned the youth to the facility, there was
another youth standing outside, pounding on the door. A staff
member eventually came outside, and upon finding out why there
was a stranger present with the youth, reportedly told the stranger
he should’ve just left the youth at the store.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone, and no additional
information as provided.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed at the facility on 05/07/2025.
Supervisor 1 reported he was not working on the day in question,
but he heard that Youth A AWOL’d on 04/25/2025. Supervisor 2
was working on 04/25/2025, however Supervisor 1 is not aware of
any exchange between staff or supervisor when Youth A returned
to the facility.
Youth A was interviewed at the facility on 05/07/2025. Youth A
reported he has been at the facility for one week. Youth A
admitted he AWOL’d because he wanted to go home. Youth A
said he and Youth B AWOL’d together and staff followed them,
but they ran away. Youth A said a stranger drove him back to the
facility, dropped him off, and he and Youth B went back through
the side door. Youth A said Supervisor 2 opened the side door for
them. Youth A said he does remember Supervisor 2 speaking with
the stranger that dropped him off. Youth A reported he is getting
enough to eat, taking his medication, and participating in therapy.
Youth A expressed no concerns regarding staff but kept saying he
wants to go home.
Youth B was interviewed at the facility on 05/16/2025. Youth B
reported he was at Wolverine Center for two months. Youth B is
2

currently in a new placement. Youth B admitted he AWOLed with
Youth A when he was at Wolverine Center, but he returned to the
facility minutes later by himself. He said Youth A went off by
himself. Youth B said when he returned to the facility, Youth A
was dropped off by someone. Youth B said Supervisor 2 then
opened the side door for them. Youth B denied hearing Supervisor
2 speak to the person that dropped off Youth A. Youth B reported
he felt safe while placed at Wolverine and did express any
concerns regarding Supervisor 2 or any other staff.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed at the facility on 05/22/2025.
Supervisor 2 reported on 04/25/2025 she was outside in the
courtyard when Youth A and Youth B AWOL’d. She said Staff 1
followed the two youths until line of sight was lost. She said
approximately 15 minutes later, Youth B and Youth A returned to
the facility. She opened the side door and saw Youth A get out of
a man’s car. The man was frustrated and appeared to be upset.
She denied she exchanged words with the man. She said Youth A
and Youth B entered the building without incident. She denied
telling the stranger he should have left the youth at the store or
leaving the youth outside for a lengthy amount of time.
Staff 1, and Staff 2 were interviewed at the facility on 05/22/2025.
Staff 1 and Staff 2 reported they were working on 04/25/2025
when Youth A and Youth B AWOL’d. Staff 1 and Staff 2 confirmed
Youth A and Youth B AWOL’d from the facility and were gone for
approximately 15 minutes before returning Staff 1 and Staff 2
denied witnessing or hearing Supervisor 2 exchange words with
the man that dropped off Youth A after he AWOL’d from the facility
or leaving youth unattended for a lengthy time outside.
Video Footage Reviewed:
Video footage was reviewed dated 04/26/2025 at approximately
7:20 pm, a white vehicle drives up and stops in front of the facility,
Youth A gets out of the vehicle, Youth B is standing in front of the
building, Youth A and Youth B walked to the front door. They are
at the front door for about 30 seconds then they walk around to
the side door and the vehicle drives off.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 04/25/2025 written by Supervisor 3.
Youth A and Youth B AWOL’d at 6:50 PM walked out of the
gym, walked down the street and cut through the trees to
Mack, line of sight was lost.
3

• Line of sight policy: staff are to providing line of sight
supervision with youth during all events staff are to remain
in ratio and maintain line of sight when in direct supervision
of the youth.
• Truancy Policy and Procedure staff are to make efforts to
verbally redirect the truanting youth and offer the youth
support and alternatives to truancy. Staff are not to
physically intervene other than in accordance with CPI
protocol. Staff are to walk with the youth while continuing to
provide verbal support and redirection encouraging the
youth not to truant. Staff are to complete an incident
reported which is to detail the events leading to the truancy,
time of truancy, and time Law Enforcement was notified.
• Supervisor 2 does not have any not disciplinary actions.
Analysis The facility is in compliance with the rule based on interviews with
staff and youths, and video footage. There is insufficient evidence
based on staff denying having any communication with the
stranger that dropped off the youth or leaving the youths outside
for an extended period of time.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
